alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Prairie; Woodruff (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 30 at 6:53PM CDT until April 30 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Tornado Warning for... South central Woodruff County in eastern Arkansas... Northeastern Prairie County in central Arkansas... Northwestern Monroe County in eastern Arkansas... * Until 730 PM CDT. * At 653 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Des Arc, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Weather spotters reported funnel cloud. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include... Brinkley... Des Arc... Fredonia... Allendale... Cotton Plant... Fargo... Dagmar WMA... Sand Hill... Little Dixie... Brasfield... Childers... This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 200 and 215. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
